text: hey guys apox fox here and welcome back
so i don't know if you can tell from my
videos over the past few months but i've
fallen head over heels with dark souls
we're getting married in the fall and
all my subscribers are invited to the
wedding you might be surprised by this
because i spent so much time complaining
about dark souls 3 in my review for it
but that was before i played dark souls
remastered which somehow made me
appreciate the series in ways i
completely overlooked before i'm now on
a quest to complete every single
soulsborne game before eldon ring comes
out next month which i will admit is
pretty ambitious because of how long and
difficult these games are but if you
want to watch my mental state
deteriorate well i'll be streaming those
games starting with bloodborne on my
channel so make sure to check those out
anyways back to dark souls remastered
there's a lot i want to cover so let's
jump right into it i never played the
original dark souls before the
remastered version and because of that i
have no reference for how much better
this game is now i can only assume that
it's pretty much the same game with some
quality of life improvements and better
graphics in dark souls you play as a
cursed dead body down on his luck until
he's given another shot at life or more
realistically 50 000 more shots at death
it's your classic coming of age story
what i appreciate about this game right
off the bat is that it throws you into
the world with very little information
on what's actually going on in my dark
souls 3 review i complained that you're
given way too much information making
the story feel convoluted and not worth
following but this time pretty much
everything is left to mystery and the
only way to learn more about the history
of lordran is to find the various npcs
scattered all around the world even then
you never get the full picture of what
happened to lordran but it made me feel
intrigued enough to want to talk to
everybody i came across and actively
listen there's a certain charm to the
dialogue in dark souls and even though
the voice acting is very hit or miss i
found a lot of the dialogue actually
pretty funny there's this overwhelming
feeling that nobody has any faith in you
and your quest because it's been
attempted about a thousand times which
makes you almost want to prove them
wrong but other than that it's all up to
you to find out the rest of the story
from observing the world around you as
you explore and that leads me to my
favorite part of dark souls remastered
which is the exceptionally good level
design in dark souls 3 the world felt
like separate levels connected by
campfires you can use to fast travel
which isn't at all a bad thing
especially with the sheer size of the
game there is zero fast traveling in the
first dark souls which at first worried
me because you'll be spending a lot of
time retracing your steps but it's
completely justified by the way the map
is laid out every time you go on a long
journey through one direction of the map
you always find yourself looping back
around to the start making it actually
really easy to get around i also really
liked the different locations in this
game everywhere from blighttown to sen's
fun house is very memorable especially
since you spend so much time learning
the ins and outs of these areas visually
i love the more simplistic art style of
dark souls probably even more than dark
souls 3 i know it's a product of its
time since the original was released
back in 2011 but these sort of matte
smooth character designs and washed out
colors is actually really pretty my
biggest complaint towards the
exploration element of this game is that
it's really easy to hit a dead end and
not know where to go next dark souls is
one of those games that opens a ton of
different paths for you to explore right
from the start but without any sort of
map or marker system it can get pretty
frustrating when you're confused where
to go next especially when the only way
to reach the next objective is to
parkour up some ruins and sit idle in a
bird's nest for 20 seconds i'm not even
joking you actually have to do that and
you better believe i had to look that
one up aside from that though i think
the level design is easily the strongest
part of dark souls remastered and if
you're somebody who enjoys metroidvania
style games there are plenty of elements
reminiscent of that genre here so next
up let's talk about the combat to be
clear i never used a mage build in this
game so i can't speak on that playstyle
but as far as the melee combat goes i
think it held up really well dark souls
puts a huge focus on spacing and
defending with a shield pretty much the
first 10 hours for me was dedicated to
learning how to parry enemies and timing
backstabs but once you master those
basics the game starts to get a lot
better there's a huge variety of enemies
and dark souls remastered and half of
the fun is coming across a new monster
and having to learn the best way to take
it out boss fights are really great in
this game i pretty much always die
during my first attempt against a boss
because they can be pretty overwhelming
when you find them but the feeling of
finally taking down a boss you've been
stuck on for hours is so rewarding if
you didn't know already there is a
multiplayer mechanic in dark souls where
you can have other players from around
the world either help you defeat a boss
or randomly show up in your game and try
to kill you i can't lie i hated this
mechanic in dark souls 3 especially
because i really never felt like i knew
what i was doing in a pvp fight so i
ended up turning it off which is a shame
because the co-op gameplay is such a
highlight of the dark souls experience i
decided to suck it up and play online in
dark souls remastered and i will admit
the positives outweigh the negatives
it's still really annoying when you
finally make it past a group of really
challenging enemies and a player
randomly shows up and kills you but i
don't know if i would have ever beaten
this game if it wasn't for the teammates
that helped me take on some of the
bosses it's also rewarding to be online
because of the messaging system where
other players will leave notes around
warning you to avoid enemy ambushes or
tricking you to jump to your death while
i'm probably going to continue to
complain about multiplayer as i progress
through the series dark souls remastered
showed me that multiplayer is pretty
essential to the soul's experience one
of the biggest strengths of the game
compared to dark souls 3 is its leveling
system while most of the mechanics
surrounding collecting souls and using
them towards making your character
stronger are pretty much the same you
can actually level up your character at
any bonfire you come across which is a
huge improvement over having to fast
travel all the way back to the firelink
shrine in dark souls 3. i'm also
slightly biased towards the leveling
system this time around because having
prior souls experience definitely helped
me know what to focus on leveling up
right from the beginning but i did feel
like the bare bones upgrading system was
a lot easier to grasp either way my
favorite part about making my character
into an overpowered machine in this game
was the quest to find all these super
powerful weapons which made exploring
each corner of the overworld that much
more rewarding i will say there were
times i had to resort to looking things
up which i'm not a huge fan of in any
game i mean how am i supposed to know
that i can get a drake sword by shooting
the dragon's tail exactly 30 times but
either way finding these secret items
and upgrading them to make yourself even
stronger was a lot of fun and finally i
wanted to touch upon the music in this
game which there really isn't a lot of
but i started to appreciate this
approach the more i played you don't
really notice that no music is playing
for the hours you spend adventuring the
world but when you enter a boss fight
and the music kicks in out of nowhere it
feels very satisfying plus returning to
the firelink shrine just to have that
really peaceful theme come on makes you
feel somehow calm in a world where
everything has fallen into chaos guys
dark souls remastered is an absolute
classic it's one of those games that i
can't believe it took me this long to
play but having that experience now was
pretty fantastic it definitely holds up
and compared to dark souls 3 i probably
enjoyed this one more but it does
intrigue me to go back and re-experience
the game with fresh eyes so have you
played dark souls remastered which
soulsborne game is your favorite also
which one should i play next make sure
to let me know down in the comments
below if you haven't subscribed already
definitely consider subscribing i've got
a new review out every week and i'm
always taking suggestions from you guys
so feel free to let me know what your
favorite games are and if i should
review them that being said thanks so
much for watching keep on gaming to the
fullest and peace
you
